intro: Amsinckia grandiflora, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy, yellow-to-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Amsinckia grandiflora is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
